verses.verse: Again the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came unto me, saying<WH559>,

Son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, speak<WH1696> to the children<WH1121> of thy people<WH5971>, and say<WH559> unto them, When I bring<WH935> the sword<WH2719> upon a land<WH776>, if the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> take<WH3947> a<WH259> man<WH376> of their coasts<WH7097>, and set<WH5414> him for their watchman<WH6822>:
If when he seeth<WH7200> the sword<WH2719> come<WH935> upon the land<WH776>, he blow<WH8628> the trumpet<WH7782>, and warn<WH2094> the people<WH5971>;

Then whosoever<WH8085> heareth<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet<WH7782>, and taketh not warning<WH2094>; if the sword<WH2719> come<WH935>, and take him away<WH3947>, his blood<WH1818> shall be upon his own head<WH7218>.

He heard<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet<WH7782>, and took not warning<WH2094>; his blood<WH1818> shall be upon him. But he that taketh warning<WH2094> shall deliver<WH4422> his soul<WH5315>.

But if the watchman<WH6822> see<WH7200> the sword<WH2719> come<WH935>, and blow<WH8628> not the trumpet<WH7782>, and the people<WH5971> be not warned<WH2094>; if the sword<WH2719> come<WH935>, and take<WH3947> any person<WH5315> from among them, he is taken away<WH3947> in his iniquity<WH5771>; but his blood<WH1818> will I require<WH1875> at the watchman's<WH6822> hand<WH3027>.

¶ So thou, O son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, I have set<WH5414> thee a watchman<WH6822> unto the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>; therefore thou shalt hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> at my mouth<WH6310>, and warn<WH2094> them from me.

When I say<WH559> unto the wicked<WH7563>, O wicked<WH7563> man, thou shalt surely<WH4191> die<WH4191>; if thou dost not speak<WH1696> to warn<WH2094> the wicked<WH7563> from his way<WH1870>, that wicked<WH7563> man shall die<WH4191> in his iniquity<WH5771>; but his blood<WH1818> will I require<WH1245> at thine hand<WH3027>.

Nevertheless, if thou warn<WH2094> the wicked<WH7563> of his way<WH1870> to turn<WH7725> from it; if he do not turn<WH7725> from his way<WH1870>, he shall die<WH4191> in his iniquity<WH5771>; but thou hast delivered<WH5337> thy soul<WH5315>.

Therefore, O thou son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, speak<WH559> unto the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>; Thus ye speak<WH559>, saying<WH559>, If our transgressions<WH6588> and our sins<WH2403> be upon us, and we pine away<WH4743> in them, how should we then live<WH2421>?

Say<WH559> unto them, As I live<WH2416>, saith<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>, I have no pleasure<WH2654> in the death<WH4194> of the wicked<WH7563>; but that the wicked<WH7563> turn<WH7725> from his way<WH1870> and live<WH2421>: turn<WH7725> ye, turn<WH7725> ye from your evil<WH7451> ways<WH1870>; for why will ye die<WH4191>, O house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>?

Therefore, thou son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, say<WH559> unto the children<WH1121> of thy people<WH5971>, The righteousness<WH6666> of the righteous<WH6662> shall not deliver<WH5337> him in the day<WH3117> of his transgression<WH6588>: as for the wickedness<WH7564> of the wicked<WH7563>, he shall not fall<WH3782> thereby in the day<WH3117> that he turneth<WH7725> from his wickedness<WH7562>; neither shall the righteous<WH6662> be able<WH3201> to live<WH2421> for his righteousness in the day<WH3117> that he sinneth<WH2398>.

When I shall say<WH559> to the righteous<WH6662>, that he shall surely<WH2421> live<WH2421>; if he trust<WH982> to his own righteousness<WH6666>, and commit<WH6213> iniquity<WH5766>, all his righteousnesses<WH6666> shall not be remembered<WH2142>; but for his iniquity<WH5766> that he hath committed<WH6213>, he shall die<WH4191> for it.
Again, when I say<WH559> unto the wicked<WH7563>, Thou shalt surely<WH4191> die<WH4191>; if he turn<WH7725> from his sin<WH2403>, and do<WH6213> that which is lawful<WH4941> and right<WH6666>;

If the wicked<WH7563> restore<WH7725> the pledge<WH2258>, give again<WH7999> that he had robbed<WH1500>, walk<WH1980> in the statutes<WH2708> of life<WH2416>, without committing<WH6213> iniquity<WH5766>; he shall surely<WH2421> live<WH2421>, he shall not die<WH4191>.
None of his sins<WH2403> that he hath committed<WH2398> shall be mentioned<WH2142> unto him: he hath done<WH6213> that which is lawful<WH4941> and right<WH6666>; he shall surely<WH2421> live<WH2421>.
¶ Yet the children<WH1121> of thy people<WH5971> say<WH559>, The way<WH1870> of the Lord<WH136> is not equal<WH8505>: but as for them, their way<WH1870> is not equal<WH8505>.
When the righteous<WH6662> turneth<WH7725> from his righteousness<WH6666>, and committeth<WH6213> iniquity<WH5766>, he shall even die<WH4191> thereby.
But if the wicked<WH7563> turn<WH7725> from his wickedness<WH7564>, and do<WH6213> that which is lawful<WH4941> and right<WH6666>, he shall live<WH2421> thereby.
¶ Yet ye say<WH559>, The way<WH1870> of the Lord<WH136> is not equal<WH8505>. O ye house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>, I will judge<WH8199> you every one<WH376> after his ways<WH1870>.

¶ And it came to pass in the twelfth<WH8147><WH6240> year<WH8141> of our captivity<WH1546>, in the tenth<WH6224> month, in the fifth<WH2568> day of the month<WH2320>, that one that had escaped<WH6412> out of Jerusalem<WH3389> came<WH935> unto me, saying<WH559>, The city<WH5892> is smitten<WH5221>.

Now the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> was upon me in the evening<WH6153>, afore<WH6440> he that was escaped<WH6412> came<WH935>; and had opened<WH6605> my mouth<WH6310>, until he came<WH935> to me in the morning<WH1242>; and my mouth<WH6310> was opened<WH6605>, and I was no more dumb<WH481>.
Then the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came unto me, saying<WH559>,

Son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, they that inhabit<WH3427> those wastes<WH2723> of the land<WH127> of Israel<WH3478> speak<WH559>, saying<WH559>, Abraham<WH85> was one<WH259>, and he inherited<WH3423> the land<WH776>: but we are many<WH7227>; the land<WH776> is given<WH5414> us for inheritance<WH4181>.

Wherefore say<WH559> unto them, Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; Ye eat<WH398> with the blood<WH1818>, and lift up<WH5375> your eyes<WH5869> toward your idols<WH1544>, and shed<WH8210> blood<WH1818>: and shall ye possess<WH3423> the land<WH776>?

Ye stand<WH5975> upon your sword<WH2719>, ye work<WH6213> abomination<WH8441>, and ye defile<WH2930> every one<WH376> his neighbour's<WH7453> wife<WH802>: and shall ye possess<WH3423> the land<WH776>?

Say<WH559> thou thus unto them, Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; As I live<WH2416>, surely they that are in the wastes<WH2723> shall fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719>, and him that is in the open<WH6440> field<WH7704> will I give<WH5414> to the beasts<WH2416> to be devoured<WH398>, and they that be in the forts<WH4679> and in the caves<WH4631> shall die<WH4191> of the pestilence<WH1698>.

For I will lay<WH5414> the land<WH776> most<WH4923> desolate<WH8077>, and the pomp<WH1347> of her strength<WH5797> shall cease<WH7673>; and the mountains<WH2022> of Israel<WH3478> shall be desolate<WH8074>, that none shall pass through<WH5674>.

Then shall they know<WH3045> that I am the LORD<WH3068>, when I have laid<WH5414> the land<WH776> most<WH4923> desolate<WH8077> because of all their abominations<WH8441> which they have committed<WH6213>.

¶ Also, thou son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, the children<WH1121> of thy people<WH5971> still are talking<WH1696> against<WH681> thee by the walls<WH7023> and in the doors<WH6607> of the houses<WH1004>, and speak<WH1696> one<WH2297> to another<WH259>, every one<WH376> to his brother<WH251>, saying<WH559>, Come<WH935>, I pray you, and hear<WH8085> what is the word<WH1697> that cometh forth<WH3318> from the LORD<WH3068>.

And they come<WH935> unto thee as the people<WH5971> cometh<WH3996>, and they sit<WH3427> before<WH6440> thee as my people<WH5971>, and they hear<WH8085> thy words<WH1697>, but they will not do<WH6213> them: for with their mouth<WH6310> they shew<WH6213> much love<WH5690>, but their heart<WH3820> goeth<WH1980> after<WH310> their covetousness<WH1215>.

And, lo, thou art unto them as a very lovely<WH5690> song<WH7892> of one that hath a pleasant<WH3303> voice<WH6963>, and can play well<WH2895> on an instrument<WH5059>: for they hear<WH8085> thy words<WH1697>, but they do<WH6213> them not.
And when this cometh to pass<WH935>, (lo, it will come<WH935>,) then shall they know<WH3045> that a prophet<WH5030> hath been among<WH8432> them.
